metadata.title: CVE-2019-14777 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The Control function of demux/mkv/mkv.cpp in VideoLAN VLC media player3.0.7.1 has a use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
libvlc5 - 3.0.8-2
libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-2
vlc - 3.0.8-2
vlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
vlc-data - 3.0.8-2
vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-2').
